Application: I applied online. The process took 2+ weeks. I interviewed at HCL.

Application: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HCL (Irvine, CA) in March 2017.

Application: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at HCL (Redmond, WA) in March 2018.
Interview Description: Submitted resume online, got a phone call and emails a few days later. Had an initial phone interview and an in person interview a few days later. The in person interview took place in stages. The first person I interviewed with asked a series of technical questions. The next asked professional background questions. The last was an HR manager who general non-technical questions.
Interview Questions: Was asked how I would design a parking lot system. Questions involving basic data structures and class designed were integrated into this question.   Answer Question

Application: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at HCL (Redmond, WA) in September 2018.
Interview Description: Extremely unprofessional, a recruiter kept rescheduling my interview at last moment and at the end when he eventually find time to take it, I was supposed to get a Skype call and instead he called me and said I am away from my system, Can we have a phone call and I said alright and He asked all SQL questions to me, Although the job description was for .NET development. I was irritated by him the way he was asking questions was like he was trying to demotivate me. Like for few answers , I started with It might or I guess and he was like you never did this before, you don't know it that's why your are saying might be etc. which is really not cool, his accent was Indian and very poorly communicating when asking question, I wish you train your interviewers well before asking them to interview because it should be nice and making interviewee comfortable and should not be like somebody is interrogating you. It sucks to have interviews with such people, It shows that the company itself is so unprofessional and employees are that arrogant
Interview Questions: Temp tables and Views, How to write a query for two tables present in different databases in different servers? Why Stored procedure? Etc.   Answer Question

Application: I applied through a recruiter. The process took a week. I interviewed at HCL (Redmond, WA) in May 2014.

Application: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at HCL in June 2016.
Interview Description: It felt like waiting in a government office.. Very unplanned interview process. They make you wait for 5 to 6 hours for 1st round of interview. Only 3 panel members for 60 + candidates. Worst interview experience with HCL. I reached the venue at 9:30 am and registered myself for dot net interview. There were approx 50 candidate for dot net and 2 Interview panel members. Though i reached early my interview did not happen till 2 pm.. I went and told them several times they told me to wait. The interview process was poorly planned. Interviewers were taking 30 to 40 mins to interview each candidate. At last i got frustrated and i left.
Interview Questions: Worst interview experience ever   1 Answer

Application: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at HCL (Hyderabad (India)) in October 2013.
Interview Description: Mainly Concentrated on C, Linux Internals ,Multi threading ,Socket Programming,Linked list, Projects you worked on and Networking concepts,If you are good you will sure be selected.Mainly two rounds of Technical and one round of HR.Hr round can be telephonic too,for me two rounds of technical panel was done and asked me to fill the HCL form and leave for the day i am not sure it was positive and later one week i got my confirmation from HCL and HR contacted via telephone.So please wait for at least one week to be a positive feed back from any company and then contact the respective person.
Interview Questions: 1)Volatile2)Function Pointers,3)Linked list .4)Tcp/Ip5)Socket Programming.   Answer Question

Application: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at HCL (Fort Kochi (India)) in March 2014.
Interview Description: Easy    Step 1: Identify Vacancy and Evaluate Need    Step 2: Develop Position Description    Step 3: Develop Recruitment Plan    Step 4: Select Search Committee    Step 5: Post Position and Implement Recruitment Plan    Step 6: Review Applicants and Develop Short List    Step 7: Conduct Interviews    Step 8: Select Hire Understand and take into consideration strategic goals for the University and/or department. Are there any upcoming changes that may impact this role?    Conduct a quick analysis of UC Core Competencies. Are there any gaps? What core skills are missing from the department? Evaluate the core skills required now and those which may be needed in the future.    Conduct a Job Analysis if this position will be new to your department. This will also help to identify gaps.
Interview Questions: Write C program code for bubble sort   1 Answer

Application: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at HCL (Chennai (India)) in May 2015.
